results.title: Rumor: a challenge film
results.creator_credit: Centre for Mass Communication of Columbia University Press
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which asks the question - “What defence against rumours?” Shows the spread of rumours in an actual case at Detroit some years ago. Mass panic and riots were caused by rumours resulting from a Sunday traffic jam.

results.title: Rumble Fish
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Fred Roos, Doug Claybourne and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning director Francis Ford Coppola’s visually stunning adaptation of the S.E. Hinton novel. Starring teen heart-throbs Matt Dillon and Mickey Rourke as two brothers whose desire to break out of their urban trap eventually leads to death for one and a new beginning for the other. Photographed in black and white with colour sequences, this striking production features a brilliant supporting cast including Dennis Hopper and boasts a musical score by Stewart Copeland.

results.title: Rules are good directions (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explores the child’s world of rules. Involves the viewer in a series of decisionmaking situations which make children aware of the need for rules, ways to judge their fairness and ways to accept responsibility for their enforcement. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Rules and tools
results.creator_credit: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
This program focuses on the basic “rules” of accounting - Debits/ Credits and the basic “tools” of accounting - Journals/Ledgers. It is explained and demonstrated by using the basic accounting equation “assets = liabilities + owner’s equity” how to determine which accounts are involved and then to analyse and record transactions using the Debit/ Credit (or double entry) rule. Journals and Ledgers are the tools for recording transactions, with Journals showing a chronological listing and Ledgers maintaining a running total of transactions in each account. Using the rules and tools of accounting it is shown how to finally produce a Balance Sheet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV

results.title: Rugrats in Paris: the movie = Rugrats II
results.creator_credit: Gabor Csupo, Arlene Klasky, MFP Munich Film Partners GmbH, GmbH and Co, Rugrats Production KG, Paul Demeyer and Stig Bergqvist
results.brief_description: When Angelica catches a few scenes from the “The Godfather” on television, she takes it upon herself to become the Bubfather and grants wishes to her fellow Rugrats. Chuckie’s wish is to have a new mother. Not long after, Stu Pickles receives an emergency call to travel to Europetarland, France, to repair a faulty Raptor and pacify rampaging theme park director, Coco LaBouche. He’s invited to bring family and friends for company and the Rugrats find themselves in Paris. In an effort to gain a promotion and become company president, the child hating Coco makes a play for Chuckie’s hapless father Chas in a desperate attempt to win favour with the outgoing President. Only Angelica knows of Coco’s cunning plan and it’s up to the Rugrats to save Chas, imperilling a few famous landmarks along the way. Humorous throughout, the film has a strong sense of familial values and what constitutes “good” parenting. Features the voices of Susan Sarandon, John Lithgow, Debbie Reynolds, Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily and Cheryl Chase.

results.title: Rugby Union football
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: A description of the fundamental principles of the game of Rugby Union Football. Filmed at Twickenham with the clubs of Richmond and Rosslyn Park, this is a visual explanation of the laws and the skills of the game in a manner which will be helpful to referees, players and spectators.
